VII. Equally monstrous is the error of those who imagine that souls will not resume the bodies which at present belong to them, but will be lurnished with others altogether different. It was the very futile reasoning of the Manichaeans, that it is absurd to expect that the flesh which is so impure will ever rise again. As if there were no impurity attached to the souls, which they nevertheless encouraged to entertain hopes of a heavenly life.
